org.transitime.api.utils

Class ApiKeyManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.api.utils.ApiKeyManager

  • public class ApiKeyManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages the ApiKeys. Caches them so API can quickly determine if key is valid.
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ApiKeyManager getInstance()
        Get singleton instance.
        Returns:

      • isKeyValid

        public boolean isKeyValid(java.lang.String key)
        Returns true if key is valid. Uses cache of keys so doesn't have to access database each time. If key not in cache then will reread keys from database in case it was just added. But won't do so more than every few seconds since more frequent access could allow an app with a bad key to cause the db to be queried to often putting an unneeded burden on the db.
        Parameters:
        key -
        Returns:

      • getApiKeys

        public java.util.List<ApiKey> getApiKeys()
        Gets the API keys from the database. Gets the session for db access. The session is specified by parameters in CoreConfig including CoreConfig.getAgencyId() for the name of the database (such as "web") and CoreConfig.getDbHost(), CoreConfig.getDbUserName(), and CoreConfig.getDbPassword(). The db host, user name, and password can also be set in the hibernate.cfg.xml file if the parameter transitime.hibernate.configFile in the CoreConfig is set.
        Returns:

      • generateApiKey

                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,

        Generates the new ApiKey and stores it in the db.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The new ApiKey or null if there was a problem such as the key
